channel.title: I want a exercise
channel.description: Give me a not to hard yet not to easy challenge. I will try to accomplish it with ONLY google and what i know.

item.title: I want a exercise
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:51, topic:141748”][quote author=Fasga link=topic=194068.msg1755573#msg1755573 date=1189757421]

Use bytes instead of booleans because booleans waste memory.

looooooooooooooooooooooooooooool!
A boolean IS a byte you nubfuck/cake.

What? A boolean is a bit, not a byte.

Anyways, how about the classic recommendation of a byte code library? I’d say that’d be pushing away from GUIs a bit, eh?
[/quote]
A boolean is 32 bits in java. Only one of the bits is actually used, but 32 are allocated.
So in conclusion, you’re both wrong.[/quote]
That’s gay.

Read full topic

I’d say that’d be pushing away from GUIs a bit, eh?[/quote]Hah, he’d have a bit of work doing it properly, and not the stupid(class template) way. To be honest, it takes a good bit of patience.

So in conclusion, you’re both wrong.

item.title: I want a exercise

item.description:
@Galook wrote:

u

And my post was on topic until that dick insulted me, I would really suggest that first site, it has over a few hunred programming exercises to help you get better at programming and problem solving. If you like pretty colors more than problems like those, then just make a game.

item.title: I want a exercise
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:40, topic:141748”][quote author=Galook link=topic=194068.msg1746656#msg1746656 date=1189471410]

Those are the gayest websites and books ever, Galook. Maybe they’re the reason you don’t know Java.

Who said I don’t know java? I do know java and have proved it, what you think java is meant for is you own opinion. Personally, I like problem solving and learning new algorithms more than making pretty colors move around on the screen. If you don’t know anything about what you are talking about then dont say anything. I’ve learned all of the most common areas in Java programming: guis, io, networking, applets, jsp, j2me, jdbc, and alot more, so if all you do with java is try to cheat on runescape then stfu.
[/quote]I bet you don’t even know what j2me/jdbc/jsp stand for.[/quote]
even a fool could google those acronyms and get a result.

I don’t remember exactly what j2me stands for, soemthing like java 2 micro edition or mini edition… some small word that starts with m

jdbc is java database connectivity, and jsp is java server pages.

Instead of saying something like that, you should ask me to prove my knowledge instead of saying something that could easily be found out in 20 seconds by using google

Read full topic

item.title: I want a exercise
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

remove_later:

Those are the gayest websites and books ever, Galook. Maybe they’re the reason you don’t know Java.

Dude, this community isn’t supposed to be about flaming. Prove that you do know Java, and post something useful. This community’s users are supposed to benefit each other with useful information. Flaming not only does not provide this information, but it causes more damage than not saying anything at all. Unless you hate this community, don’t hurt it.

item.title: I want a exercise
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

Compress some stuffs using huffman coding. It was an interesting topic to me whenI first learned trees.

edit: Or check some of these sites out:

http://www.programming-challenges.com/pg.php?page=index
http://www.doc.ic.ac.uk/~ajf/Teaching/Haskell/Challenges.pdf

^^ some of the ones I used back when I found that stuff interesting, if you want to find more, just google “programming challenges”

The first 2 are really good though and touch up on alot of common problems with different difficulties.

Read full topic
